definition: to ward off evil spirits/mythical lion-like animal that wards off evil (also called 貔貅[pi2 xiu1])
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

sentences.english: The animal imaged deity of the nether world buried in the tomb was surposed to have the fu…
sentences.chinese: 土伯后土神獸形象置於墓中有辟邪鎮墓作用。

sentences.english: The pharaohs of ancient Egypt wore blue for protection against evil.
sentences.chinese: 古埃及法老穿藍色以辟邪。

sentences.english: Soon, evil spirits in the house try to take Sally to the dark side.
sentences.chinese: 不久，在家裏辟邪儘量採取薩莉的陰暗面。

sentences.english: Chinese knot is used for exchange as a gift, praying for …. and protecting against …. as jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 中國結常常作爲禮物交換或作爲飾品祈求好運和辟邪。

sentences.english: Both the Chinese and Muslims burn amber as incense as a protection against evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 中國人和穆斯林都把琥珀當作香來燒，以驅鬼辟邪。

sentences.english: Sobriety is one of the Ghost Festival, demons, nature is capable of warding off evil into willow.
sentences.chinese: 清明是鬼節之一，百鬼出沒，插柳自然是辟邪了。

sentences.english: The following three feet is alien monster, have the lines.
sentences.chinese: 下面三足是異型怪獸，有鎮宅辟邪之附會。

sentences.english: Fireworks and firecrackers traditionally welcome the lunar new year to ward off evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 按照傳統，燃放煙花爆竹是爲了迎接農曆新年和辟邪。

sentences.english: Wearing garlic around your neck won't scare off evil. That's just an old wives' tale.
sentences.chinese: 脖子上戴大蒜不會辟邪的，那只是迷信的說法。

sentences.english: YueLingShan and LinPingZhi still to find wizardry sword of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 嶽靈珊和林平之還是來找辟邪劍譜的。

definition: mythical animal that brings luck and wards off evil, having head of a dragon and lion's body, often with hoofs, wings and tail/also written 辟邪/fig. valiant soldier
to drive out devils and spirits exorcism
lit. inviting wealth/We wish you success and riches (cf idiom 招財進寶|招财进宝[zhao1 cai2 jin4 bao3])
stone tablet erected to ward off evil spirits
to ward off calamities/to avoid disaster
